II. By reason of the fact that you are the second son born in my womb, and because of the love and affection I have for you, and in return for my love for you, I hereby grant you some immovable property free of charge, and all the immovable property which has come to me by inheritance as per the 3rd paragraph below, is my right of possession from that date to this day. All the immovable property in the possession of the deceased, which has not been mortgaged or otherwise encumbered by any person, and has a market value of Rs. 11,83,000/- (in words), eleven lakhs eighty-three thousand rupees, is hereby granted to you as a reward for your love for me and is hereby granted to you free of charge and you shall immediately take possession of the said property. Furthermore, from now on, you shall register your name in the accounts of the government and pay taxes, etc., and shall enjoy the said property happily and freely with all powers of loan, donation, sale, and sale, as well as with your son, grandson, and descendants. Whatever may happen to this (property) at any time or by anyone, all of them shall remain my I hereby declare that the property to be settled by this property does not include any mango, coconut, betel, sweet potato trees, orchards, precious minerals, mines, granite or other stone quarries, machinery, fish ponds, etc. and I hereby agree to be prosecuted and liable to pay the appropriate duty if any such material fact is concealed in this deed. Any concealment of facts in this matter may be prosecuted in court under sections 27 and 64 of the Indian Stamp Act. K.SreedeviSheet Endorsement

2016 dated 03-12-2016 is hereby settled by this document I hereby certify that no one else has any right to the property, i.e. the property that I have inherited, and that I have not sold or transacted any property with anyone and that I have not made any encroachments on it. I have thoroughly examined all the necessary documents, such as the deed link documents, mortgage/encumbrance certificates, addresses of the parties, photographs of the parties, property details, etc., and have included them in this deed. sections.content: The property covered under Gift Settlement Deed No 525 of 2026 dated 29/Jan/2026, executed by Kolanti Sreedevi in favour of her Second Son, Kolanti Sai Jagadish, towards the property admeasuring an extent of 86.166 Sq. Yds, bearing house number 10-616/1, comprised in survey number 303 situated in Thimmapuram sivaru Gokulapadu Village, Thimmapuram Panchayat, S.Rayavarm Mandal within the District of Anakapalli registered at sub-registrar office Yelamanchili(310) is bounded as follows: North by: C.C. Road South by: House of Kotari Nagamani East by: Basement Property of Noothi Chinna West by: C C road Note:: Schedule property is part of Gramakantam as per deed
It is noted from the given documents and EC that the schedule property is not part of any active Mortgage or Lease Deed.

Note:: It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number, and Split Survey/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible.
